WRITING.TEXT:
Let's look at his past behavior and attitude towards this election. He consistently lies to seem appealing to whomever he's speaking to. He lies, blatantly and regularly, as though no one is noticing. He is clearly doing whatever it takes to win the election, at any expense. He has preyed on weaker companies to earn himself a buck. He cheats the tax system for personal gain. I think this is textbook behavior for a person clearly lacking any type of moral compass or conscious at all for that matter. It's as though he is running just for him. To hell with the rest of us; he just wants to get into the White House. What say ye Reddit?
EDIT:many of you are unclear on the meaning of the word sociopath. Here you are
Sociopath: A person with a personality disorder manifesting itself in extreme antisocial attitudes and behavior and a lack of conscience.

I've been where you are. Not with regards to how the split occurred, but the emotional toll that it takes on you. The one piece of advice that I cant give you is to throw anything out that you got from or shared with her. I know you'd rather not. I know that those were good times. I know it all means so much to you, but the reality is that the stuff is torturing you. Constantly reminding you of her. Then you go and give her the attention she wants. She is enjoying being able to have you want her. She feels cool blowing you off and having a sense of control over you.
Listen, get rid of it all, if you have anything from her that is, and don't give it to friends or donate it. send it to a landfill or burn it. its cathartic. If this doesn't apply to you, I wont mind if you ignore it.
Good luck to you

WRITING.TEXT:
It occurred to me that Christian persecution is a real problem around the world. Christians are being persecuted by Radical Islam, Orthodox Judea and any other religion not their own. Much like Christianity did to other religions in the past. So, religions massacring other religions. Sounds about right.
Thank you for reading my useless rant.

WRITING.TITLE: Thoughts on gods
WRITING.TEXT:
My mother is a christian. She had indoctrinated since birth by my grandparents. I don't think them to have been unpleasant people. I conclude that they too were recruited into the religion at an early age and so on and so forth.
My take on god is such that, I view them to be a hindrance on personal willpower. My mother, a fiscally responsible nurse of about forty years, credits her god with her success. When I stated that she was a good parent and person not because her religious beliefs, but because of her hard work and excellent moral compass, she said,
"Don't say things like that because I don't want to die yet."
As if taking credit for her own hard work was some sort of sin. Gods will make a person weak and doubtful of their own abilities. They will torment the mind of an otherwise reasonable person. God are petty, greedy and spiteful. Even if gods had existed, they wouldn't be worthy of our love and praise. Gods are immature children. I'm sure this sentiment is shared with many others in the world, but I felt a distinct need to articulate my feelings in prose.
Thank you for taking the time to read my useless rant.

WRITING.TITLE: A child with me or would anyone do?
WRITING.TEXT: Was just thinking about some of the shows and movies that portray some women as being in a hurried frenzy to have children. The motive is so strong that they schedule sex, nag their SO for sex at the "right" time, etc. Then there is real life. Women such as Nadia Suleman (I name here because of her prominence in the media spotlight), have eight babies and no father in the picture. I realize this isn't the case for all women, but I am curious as to whether the desire to have a child outweighs the decision as to with whom you will have the child. Sure seemed that way with Mr. Brad Pitt. Although, I know nothing of his personal life, so please take that last part as blatant speculation.

WRITING.TITLE: Suddenly...Relationship?
WRITING.TEXT:
I was helping my neighbor set up her grill so that her and her friend could make some burgers. I heard them talking behind me and in a louder voice my neighbor says to her friend, "Oh, this is my new boyfriend".
Now, I know she was kidding, but it made me think about others out there. Have any of you guys/gals ever sprung this on someone and meant it? Conversely, have you ever been put in that situation and thought, "Guess I'm in a relationship" ?
edit: sense.

WRITING.TITLE: Random mumblings from a bumbling idiot
WRITING.TEXT:
I am not well versed in many things. I don't have the best social skills. I do, however, know people. I'm nearing thirty years and I feel as though people are the one thing that I have learned very well. What I am thinking, so are others. What I am doing, so are others. Thus, it is easy to decipher the halfhearted smile you give at nights end. Even easier to detect is the lie that you just told me. You are convinced that I am not aware or your treachery, but I am. I'm noting everything. Keeping record of your discord and taking in future lessons of future people.
I do apologize for my rant.

Thank you for the feedback and the links. I was attempting to imply that the people who have the most to lose, i.e. the people in power and the people capable of influencing the people in power by monetary means, are the people who would stifle progress at the peril of the general population. Looking at it this way bring to me the thought that Hollywood is acting as the propaganda arm for the government.
I understand that the web as a whole is not the most disciplined entity, but when given more thought, the web populace is made up of people like you, me and people smarter than both of us. It's those people to whom I'm referring when I talk about the internet community. You only have to remember as far back as the SOPA/PIPA legislation to get a feel for what I mean.
I've been lurking on reddit for about a year now, so I'm familiar with some of the oddities around here. Sometimes the memes can be a bit much, but I do find a worthwhile amount of insight when it comes down to it. I visited the likes you suggested before writing this and I think it will be a great addition to my learning about well, anything. I do appreciate your words of caution though. Off to reddit for a bit. Who am I kidding? I'll be on reddit all day.

WRITING.TITLE: OMFG!! Has anyone else seen how doomed we are today!!!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for the tip :D

WRITING.TITLE: What if at this point in history...
WRITING.TEXT:
My thoughts tend to be a bit murky coming out so please bear with me. Input Welcome :D
There's a thought that has been on my mind a lot recently. It has to do with this great unity of the informed. I'm referring to the protests against governments and massive political involvement from my and younger generations . Now, I've always viewed the web as a physical manifestation of the human psyche. From the most perverse fantasies, to the desire to help others. I can't say this with any definitive certainty, I just compare from my own thoughts alongside what I observe online. Back to my failing attempt to make a point.
Governments, like any like-minded group of people, are, from what I can tell, subject to group think. This would be a non-issue in any other case, but it is an issue here because they are capable of great destruction and great corruption, which in turn affects the lives of the governed.
So here we have the government with its enforcers (LE), abusing their positions. Now because of these abuses, as is normally the case, the governed get upset. The difference between past anger and modern anger is that we, the web collective, are able to reach a global consensus as to how we should approach a given situation. For the first time in history, we are able to be everywhere and nowhere all the time. This seems to be what scares them.
These latest pieces of legislation are not about piracy or money. They're about maintaining power. Governments see how angry the middle east protests were, but that's not what bothered them. It was the effectiveness with which the people were able to organize and subsequently overthrow governments that were so confident in their power over their citizens. Keep the people dumb and ignorant and you wont have to hear from them. That used to be the way, but it's not entirely possible now. In some places maybe, but not the vast majority of the world.
It seems as though this kind of community moderated environment could someday make a move to the real world. While it is evident that we as a species have much to improve upon, it does seem as though the roots of what could be a beautiful future are starting here, on this fledgling internet. The free sharing of information, helping those in dire need, free thought, a society where an individual can truly write their own ticket, a community moderated world. In a place like that, why would you need a government?
This, it seems, is what the recent attacks on the web have been about. Not piracy or money, but adhering to a system that is clear unable/unwilling to keep up a forward-thinking social mindset.
I hope someone has been able to understand what I was trying to say here....
Edit:i no make sense. icebirds orders. thnx for the feedback.
